summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 26, 2019, discussing the coordination of victim notification lists between FBI offices for the Miami (MM) and New York (NY) cases involving Jeffrey Epstein. The email focuses on importing a victim list from the Miami case into the New York case system and ensuring victim support.

events.title: FBI email coordination on victim lists
events.description: Internal FBI email exchange regarding the import of a victim notification list from the Miami (MM) Epstein case into the New York (NY) case system, and coordination of victim support services.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating victim notification efforts between the Miami (MM) and New York (NY) Epstein cases as of July 2019.
A Victim Notification System (VNS) was used to manage lists of victims associated with the Epstein investigations.
The email indicates an intent to import the Miami victim list into the New York case system, suggesting operational integration between the two investigations.
The correspondence emphasizes confidentiality and the protection of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) of victims.
The email chain shows FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) involvement in providing support to victims in both the current and former cases.
